title: Business Live: US shares slide - BBC News
summary: dow jones slips on the day .
moss bros profits slide amid tough trading .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for today on business live - thanks for reading .
i 'll be back at 06:00 tomorrow with the latest , breaking news .
do join us then for all the stories and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: us stocks close lower
text: us stock markets ended lower as investors dumped technology shares amid fears about regulation of social media companies and autonomous vehicles .
the dow jones slipped 1.4 % to 23,857.71 points , while the s & p 500 lost 1.7 % to 2,612.62 .
the tech-rich nasdaq lost almost 3 % to 7,008.81 .
among the biggest tech fallers was electric car firm tesla , down 8 % after regulators opened an investigation into a crash involving one of its vehicles .
facebook dived nearly 5 % as its data privacy scandal widened .
at a dcms committee hearing , cambridge analytica whistleblower christopher wylie claimed that leaked facebook data had been indirectly used to sway the 2016 us election and the brexit vote .

documents.title: slovakia suspends uber services
text: ride hailing taxi firm uber has been ordered to suspend all operations in slovakia .
the decision was made due to a lawsuit filed in january by certified taxi drivers in the country , who claim that uber presents unfair competition in their industry .
although the court ordered uber to halt its services on 6 march , the decision was only announced today , and uber is still running in slovakia 's capital city bratislava .
the european court of justice ruled in december that uber needs to be regulated just like other taxi operators and classed as a transport provider .

documents.title: 'because you ca n't watch everything '
text: might sound a bit counter-intuitive , but the publishers of the film magazine empire are spreading their wings to the small screen with a new title called pilot tv .
it 's described as `` your glossy guide to the best of the box ( because , well , in the age of streaming and box-sets it 's impossible to watch everything ) '' , with exclusives and expert insight .
pilot goes on sale on 5 april and features writing by boyd hilton of heat magazine , guardian columnist julia raeside , michael hogan and more .

documents.title: ryanair cabin crew strike to hit portugal
text: some ryanair cabin crew in portugal will go ahead with one-day strikes during the easter holidays after the budget airline failed to meet demands on working conditions .
the strikes by unionised cabin crew are set for 29 march , 1 april 1 and 4 april 4 .
the snpvac union said it was still in ryanair 's hands to avoid the walkout .
the airline said it did not expect a lot of crew to join the walkout but disruptions were possible .

documents.title: may says nhs is crucial to her
text: theresa may has revealed she has a personal stake in keeping the nhs healthy .
`` i rely on the nhs every day as a diabetic , '' she told the commons liaison committee earlier .
`` i 'm eternally grateful to the nhs . ''
she told mps there there are `` serious cost and demand pressures '' on the health service but promised a long-term funding plan to help the nhs cope with extra demands .

documents.title: us shares dip downwards
text: the dow jones industrial average has reversed early gains and is now showing a 0.29 % decline on the day to 7107.19 .
the s & p 500 has dropped even further , falling 0.65 % to 2641.18 .
but the tech-heavy nasdaq has taken the biggest hit , slumping 1.57 % to 7107.19 .

documents.title: facebook shares slump further
text: facebook shares have slumped a further 3.5 % today to 154.5 , continuing a recent trend , after its boss faced a clamour of calls to appear before lawmakers .
mark zuckerberg turned down british mps ' invitations to explain to a british parliamentary committee what went wrong .
the head of the committee damian collins called zuckerberg 's decision `` astonishing '' and urged him to think again .
but it looks likely he will face the music in the us .
facebook said the company had received invitations to testify before congress and that they were talking to legislators .
house energy and commerce committee spokeswoman elena hernandez said `` the committee is continuing to work with facebook to determine a day and time for mr. zuckerberg to testify '' .

documents.title: vw compensation case continues tomorrow
text: a case involving thousands of disgruntled motorists is gearing up at the high court .
volkswagen , audi , seat and skoda owners want compensation from volkswagen in what could be the largest consumer action in uk legal history .
more than 60,000 individuals are already represented by various law firms out of a total of 1.2 million potential claimants .
at a preliminary hearing in london today , senior master fontaine was due to hear an application for a group litigation order to set a deadline for the claims and to appoint lead solicitors .

after a day of out-of-court discussions , oliver campbell qc for the claimants represented by slater and gordon told the judge that a proposed order would be prepared for when the hearing resumes on wednesday .

documents.title: may ditches blackberry in favour of new-fangled iphone
text: talking of apple products , theresa may has finally replaced her blackberry mobile device with an iphone .
the prime minister had been the `` last member of the no 10 team '' still using a blackberry handset , news site politico reported .
the canadian company behind blackberry stopped making smartphones itself in 2016 , following a steep decline in sales , and licensed other companies to make devices in its name .

documents.title: apple announces cheaper ipad aimed at students
text: apple has unveiled a new version of its 9.7-inch ipad at a new lower price that is compatible with the apple pencil for the first time .
until now , only the top-end ipad pro supported apple 's digital stylus .
the new device will start at $ 319 in the us , with the apple pencil available for an additional $ 89 .
the technology giant also confirmed the new ipad would be available at a discounted price for schools , although no uk prices have been announced yet .

documents.title: number of home movers halves in a decade
text: homeowners are moving half as often as they did before the credit crunch , figures produced for the bbc suggest .
reasons include high house prices , stricter rules on getting mortgages and older people staying on in large properties .
people used to move house roughly four times after their first purchase .
now it is more like twice .
read more

documents.title: breakinggreat ormond street votes to keep cash from presidents club
text: the great ormond street children 's hospital has voted to keep £ 530,000 donated by the scandal-hit presidents club , according to a sky news report .

it says the fundraising arm of great ormond street hospital ( gosh ) agreed at a board meeting today to overturn its original decision to return £ 530,000 donated by the presidents club charitable trust .
gosh 's charity trustees initially said they would return money raised at presidents club events between 2009 and 2016 , although the hospital had not been a beneficiary of this year 's dinner .

documents.title: consumer experts blast iresa
text: consumer groups have been weighing in with views about the ban on new customers for energy firm iresa .
moneysavingexpert 's martin lewis said :
this is a very important step by ofgem .
for many of its customers iresa has not come close to living up to even minimum standards .
i hear often of customers locked into its plans , with no way to move and no way to contact it .
the big question here is should the firm be allowed a licence at all ?
alex neill , which ?
managing director of home services , said :
iresa has form for appalling customer service , this is the second time in a year the regulator has stopped them from gaining new customers and ordered improvements .
the company now must ensure it changes for the long term otherwise the regulator will need to go further to protect consumers .

documents.title: markets climb across europe
text: it was n't just the ftse 100 that climbed today , european markets were also on the up .
germany 's dax surged 1.6 % while the cac 40 in france pushed 1 % higher .
however the pound dropped back 0.5 % against the dollar as cooling tensions between america and china caused the us dollar to strengthen .
the price of oil remained in positive territory , lifting 0.2 % to 70.14 a barrel , on the prospect of opec production cuts being extended to 2019 .

documents.title: jaguar self-drive car revealed
text: the first self-styled `` premium '' autonomous car has been unveiled in new york - and it 's a jaguar .
the jaguar i-pace , made in conjunction with google 's self-driving unit waymo , will be tested on public roads this year .
by 2020 , the firms say 20,000 self-driving jaguar sport utility vehicles ( suvs ) will be part of waymo 's public fleet .

documents.title: stock market turmoil hits us consumer confidence
text: us consumer confidence fell from more than a 17-year high in march on the back of stock market volatility .
but households remained upbeat about labor market conditions , which could help to support consumer spending , according to the us conference board .
its consumer confidence index dropped 2.3 points to a reading of 127.7 this month from a slightly downwardly revised 130 in february , which was the highest level since november 2000 .
`` the stock market has been volatile and consumers do n't like market volatility , '' said chris rupkey , chief economist at mufg in new york .
`` still , we wonder if the decline in confidence means that the economy may have seen its best days already for this cycle . ''

documents.title: viewers drop for itv 's cheltenham festival coverage
text: itv racing 's second year of covering from the cheltenham festival saw a 4 % drop in viewing figures overall and a 14 % drop in the peak audience for the cheltenham gold cup .
figures released by the broadcaster today show the total audience across the four afternoons of this year 's festival was 3.423m .
however , itv 's total audience was more than a quarter higher than that attracted by the final year of channel 4 's coverage in 2016 .
itv 's shares were one of the few ftse 100 losers today , falling 0.10 % to 145.1p .

documents.title: dow climbs more than 200 points
text: the dow jones industrial average has been making decent gains in morning trading in the us .
leading the winners is general electric , which has climbed 5.39 % to 13.59 .
nike is up 2.17 % while proctor & gamble has risen 1.42 % .

documents.title: irn bru sales rise on back of new recipe
text: the maker of irn bru has reported its sharpest annual rise in sales of the soft drink , up by 8 % .
ag barr issued its figures for the year to january with strong results also for its rubicon fruit drink brand , up 5 % , and funkin mixers , up 25 % .
the firm cited an increase in market share , and moving most of its products out of the reach of the new sugar levy .

documents.title: it 's zuckerberg 's call , says may
text: speaking of mark zuckerberg , theresa may says she hopes the facebook chief understands why people are concerned about alleged leaks of personal data - but it is up to him to decide whether to give evidence to mps .

`` mr zuckerberg will decide for himself whether he wants to come before the committee , but what i hope , is that facebook will recognise why this is so significant for people and why it is that people are so concerned about it , and ensure that the committee is able to get the answers that they want , '' the prime minister told mps on the liaison select committee this afternnoon .
mps said earlier they still wanted to question mr zuckerberg after facebok said it would send another executive to appear before them .

documents.title: breakingzuckerberg to testify before congress : reports
text: mark zuckerberg has decided he will testify before congress , according to press reports .

cnnmoney says that facebook sources have told it that the 33-year-old chief executive `` has come to terms with the fact that he will have to testify before congress within a matter of weeks , and facebook is currently planning the strategy for his testimony '' .
if he does testify it will put pressure on google chief sundar pichai and twitter chief jack dorsey to do the same , the report suggests .
senate judiciary chairman chuck grassley has officially invited all three bosses to a hearing on data privacy on 10 april .

documents.title: ftse closes the day 100 points higher
text: the ftse 100 closed up more than 100 points today .
it finished the day at 6994.85 , up 1.54 % , or 106 points .
the biggest climber was plumb center owner ferguson which rose 6.54 % to £ 54.70 .
other big climbers included glaxosmithkline , up 4.84 % , shire , up 3.94 % , and scottish mortgage , up 3.54 % .
the biggest loser was next , which fell 1.72 % to 84p ,

documents.title: profits up for plumb center owner despite closures
text: plumb center owner ferguson said it had closed another 52 branches in the uk amid tough trading over its first half .
but operating profits climbed 15 % to $ 698m ( £ 493m ) for the six months to 31 january on the back of a strong us performance .

documents.title: more banks reveal high gender pay gaps
text: morgan stanley and citi have announced median gender pay gaps of 35.2 % and 30.1 % , the latest in a string of banks to reveal the figures .
both lenders blamed the imbalance on the high number of men in senior roles : in the top pay quartile , 80.7 % of morgan stanley uk group employees are male .
the banks joined bank of america and credit suisse , which earlier announced gender pay gaps of 30.5 % and 28.9 % respectively .

documents.title: stagecoach hit by bad weather
text: stagecoach has blamed the 'beast from the east ' for its latest sales blow .
the group said like-for-like revenue growth at its regional bus arm fell 2.5 % for the latest four-week period following the snow disruption in february and march .
it also caused regional bus sales to struggle for the 44 weeks to march 3 , falling 0.1 % .
despite the hit , stagecoach said it was on track for annual earnings targets , with revenues at uk rail and virgin rail growing 3.2 % and 2.8 % respectively for the 44-week period .

documents.title: watchdog probes telit
text: technology firm telit communications is being investigated by the city watchdog over a major profit warning last year .
the financial conduct authority is looking at the `` timeliness of announcing certain matters '' included within its half-year results last august , according to telit .
it comes after telit warned on annual profits earlier this month following a tough year that included the sacking of its chief executive oozi cats amid questions over his identity .

documents.title: dlr strike from 4am tomorrow
text: a 48-hour strike on london 's docklands light railway will go ahead from 4am on wednesday after talks failed to avert the action .
transport for london has warned it is unlikely that any dlr services will run during the walkout by members of the rail , maritime and transport union .
a second phase of action will coincide with the london marathon next month .

documents.title: melrose 's response offers 'nothing to assure workers '
text: labour 's shadow business secretary rebecca long-bailey has criticised business secretary greg clark for waiting until the `` last minute '' to get assurances from melrose , as she said concerns about the plans had been raised for months .
she went on :
sadly the letter sent by the government yesterday and the response by melrose offer very little certainty and raise even more questions .

if the government thinks that today 's weak , late and unenforceable assurances from melrose are sufficient then they are deeply mistaken : there is nothing to assure workers nor put to bed concerns about our industrial strategy and national security .

documents.title: credit suisse reveals 29 % gender pay gap
text: investment bank credit suisse has revealed that it has a gender pay gap in its uk office .
women are paid 29 % less than men on a median hourly basis , and women made up only 14 % of all managing directors globally at the end of 2017 , up from 11 % in 2015 .
when it comes to bonuses , there is gender pay gap of 70.2 % .
overall , the median pay gap improve , dropping from 31.9 % in 2016 to 28.9 % in 2017 .

for me , these numbers are disappointing , and while they reflect an improvement , there is clearly much work to be done , '' uk chief executive and group chief financial officer david mathers wrote in a memo sent to uk employees .
addressing this gap through a more gender-balanced workforce at our own organisation and across the broader financial services industry , will take time . ''

documents.title: wall street has mixed opening
text: wall street has had a mixed opening today .
the dow jones industrial average is 50 points , or 0.2 % , higher at 24,253 .
but the s & p 500 slipped 1.59 points , or 0.06 % , at 2,656 while the tech-focused nasdaq is 0.3 % better at 7,242 points .

documents.title: huawei challenges samsung and apple with new phone
text: huawei 's latest smartphone can take photos in near-dark conditions without using its flash or a tripod .
the p20 pro takes exposures lasting up to six seconds to get enough light .
it then uses artificial intelligence to deliver sharp images and avoid the blurring and smearing normally associated with employing this technique handheld .
the chinese company recently told the bbc it could soon become the world 's bestselling smartphone brand .

documents.title: gkn : clark awaits mod advice
text: business secretary greg clark says he will only make a decision on whether to intervene in melrose 's proposed takeover of gkn on national security grounds after the ministry of defence has delivered its expert advice .
he made the comments in an urgent question on the issue in the house of commons .
it was not clear when that advice would arrive .
mr clark has written to melrose demanding `` binding '' commitments from the turnaround specialist over its £ 8.1bn bid for the engineering giant .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: what 's happening in markets ?
text: the ftse 100 has remained up nearly 2 % on the day at 7,024.47 .
gsk is top of the risers , with its share price up 6.2 % to £ 13.68 , following its $ 13bn deal with novartis .
there are just three fallers : next has dropped 0.94 % to £ 48.29 , itv is down 0.31 % to 144.8p , and kingfisher has fallen 0.28 % to 287.4p .

documents.title: amazon says oui to monoprix
text: shares in casino are sharply higher in paris after amazon announced a deal with the french supermarket 's upmarket monoprix chain to sell its groceries .
the move , which is set to shake up the french food retail market , has led to speculation that it could herald a bigger deal .
amazon bought whole foods for $ 13.7bn last year , and has also struck a deal for amazon prime to sell products from morrisons in the uk .
groceries from monoprix will be available in the amazon prime now app and website on a dedicated virtual store .
the deal is limited to paris and suburbs , but monoprix boss regis schultz said it could be extended .
monoprix is one of france 's best-known store chains , with a network of nearly 800 upmarket stores in about 250 cities .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: breakingdominic chappell faces ban over bhs
text: the insolvency service says it has written to dominic chappell and three other former directors of bhs informing them that it intends to bring proceedings against them to have them disqualified from running or controlling any company for up to 15 years .
separately , the insolvency service announced that it would not take disqualification action against former bhs owner sir philip green for selling the retailer to dominic chappell for £ 1 in 2015 .

documents.title: breaking'absolutely astonishing '
text: the digital , culture , media and sport committee 's chair damian collins says it is `` absolutely astonishing '' that facebook 's chief executive mark zuckerberg wo n't appear before mps for questioning over the data scandal .

documents.title: ford and alibaba launch 'car vending machine ' in china
text: ford has teamed up with e-commerce giant alibaba to unveil a five-storey-high vending machine holding 42 automobiles .
you can now buy a car from the machine in under 10 minutes , with no help from a human .
the models available include the ford explorer suv and the mustang .
users use the tmall app to put down a deposit digitally and request a car they want to inspect , test drive or purchase .

the app then takes a selfie of the user , and when the user arrives at the vending machine , a computer uses facial recognition technology to verify the person 's identity by comparing it to the selfie .

documents.title: meet the woman who wants to turn artists into 'artpreneurs '
text: buying a piece of art has long been considered an investment , of time as well as money , requiring visits to galleries and trips to auction houses .
but technology is changing the way we interact with , buy , and sell art .
and artists are adapting their creative processes to suit a changing landscape .
`` there 's never been a better time to be an artist in the world , '' says ashley longshore .
the us artist 's paintings can be found hanging in the homes of actors such as such as salma hayek and penelope cruz .

documents.title: west coast mainline up for tender
text: transport correspondent victoria fritz tweets :
the transport secretary chris grayling opens the west coast mainline franchise to tender .
this is set to run until 2031 ; taking us well into the world of hs2 .
labour mp rachael maskell calls it `` thin gruel '' .
where 's the detail on the future of the east coast , she asks ?
virgin to sue again if they do n't get the contract ?

documents.title: why paper is the real 'app killer '
text: digital natives are ditching apps , and turning instead to old-fashion pen and paper , it seems .
every january , angela ceberano sets goals for the 12 months ahead .
and on sunday nights , she plans and organises the coming week .

but instead of spreadsheets and fancy smartphone apps , the melbourne , australia-based founder of public relations firm flourish pr , uses notepads , an old-fashioned diary , coloured pens and a stack of magazines .
with these , she brainstorms , makes lists and creates a vision board .
read more here .

documents.title: 'light at the end of the tunnel ' for investors
text: stock markets across europe have been helped on tuesday by a recovery in the us .
joshua mahony , market analyst at ig group , said : `` european markets are in rebound mode , with yesterday 's relief rally in the us helping drive gains across asia and europe .

`` yesterday 's 664-point rally in the dow [ jones industrial average ] amounted to the third biggest single day point gain in history , with investors beginning to see light at the end of the tunnel after a period which threatened to see a global trade war break out . ''

documents.title: where next for oil prices ?
text: brent crude prices may be over $ 70 a barrel but some observers believe they may not hold that position .
tamas varga , analyst at pvm oil associates , says : `` the recent rally in oil prices might have taken some by surprise as the underlying fundamental does not justify brent being close to $ 70/bbl .
`` this view is based on the simple fact that non-opec oil supply growth will trump the increase in global oil demand this year . ''
he adds : `` the price strength of the last couple of weeks is down to two factors .
the first one is a stable opec output level which leads to impressive compliance ( with an oil supply-cutting deal ) .
the second one is supply-side geopolitical developments in venezuela , libya and iran , the most acute of which is iran . ''

documents.title: gambling watchdog considers credit card ban
text: the gambling commission is considering banning the use of credit cards in online betting .
the regulator 's reportinto how to make online gambling safer said consumers `` should not gamble with money that they do not have '' .
betting operators have suggested credit cards are used for between 10 % and 20 % of deposits online .
before taking action the regulator will explore whether a ban would instead force people to use `` payday '' loans .
read more here .

documents.title: uk stocks higher
text: the ftse 100 has extended gains , with the blue chip index now up nearly 2 % , or 134 points , at 7,022 .
pharma giant gsk has moved to the top of the risers , with its share price up 5.7 % to £ 13.65 , following its $ 13bn deal with novartis .
there is only one faller - next - whose share price dipped 8p to £ 48.67 .
the ftse 250 is now up 1.1 % , or 225 points , at 19,412 .
investors , however , do n't like the news that superdry 's co-founder julian dunkerton is stepping down from the fashion chain : shares are down 6.9 % at £ 15.37 .

documents.title: mps keep spotlight on zuckerberg
text: while facebook 's mark zuckerberg has declined a request to appear in front of mps to answer questions about its massive date breach , the chair of the commons digital , culture , media and sport committee has extended an invitation to the firm 's chief product officer chris cox who was offered as an alternative .

but committee chair damian collins said : `` given the seriousness of these issues we still believe that mark zuckerberg is the right person to give evidence , and would like him to confirm if he will make himself available to the committee .
`` he stated in interviews that if he is the right person to appear he will appear .
we think he is the right person and look forward to hearing from him . ''

documents.title: customers will see improvements , says iresa
text: iresa has responded to ofgem which has banned the energy provider from taking on new customers until it resolves a number of service issues .
it says : iresa is actively working to fix the issues raised by ofgem .
`` we are confident that our customers will see a noticeable improvement in our customer service response times and we apologise to customers who we have let down in the past .
`` we are committed to improving our quality of service to deliver a much better customer experience . ''

documents.title: analysis : a change in direction for gkn bid ?
text: the battle royal for one of the uk 's oldest and biggest engineering firms took another significant twist on tuesday as the government prompted would-be-acquirer melrose to offered a number of legally binding commitments if its £ 8bn takeover of gkn is successful .
business secretary , greg clark , wrote to melrose asking the company to use rules set up after the debacle of kraft 's broken promises over cadbury to give firm undertakings about gkn 's future .

in response , melrose has promised to spend at least 2.2 % of revenues on research and development , create a new £ 10m apprentice fund and a pledge not to sell gkn 's aerospace division for five years .
according to people close to the deal , melrose would have been happy to commit to most of this without prompting .
read simon 's full analysis here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: the $ 1m pocket watch
text: the six-day baselworld luxury watch fair , which ends today , had its fair share of a-list celebs sprinkling stardust over the event .
but the real show-stopper was tucked away behind locked doors .
this pocket watch from jaquet droz is a remarkable example of the craftsmanship that still exists in the swiss watch industry .
completely hand-made and hand-painted with enamel , the internals of the watch have 668 parts .
inlaid with a 1,000 tiny gems and featuring an egg which cracks open after which the chick is fed by the mother parrot , it took three years to design and make .
the all-new opening mechanism is being patented .
jaquet droz chief executive christian lattmann says the effort and materials are priced at about $ 1m .
the question now is whether to sell or keep , he says .
made in honour of 18th century watchmaker pierre jaquet-droz , it was destined for the company 's museum .
we have already had two offers during the show , '' lattmann says .
we could make more , but no two watches would ever be the same . ''
author: Russell Hotten
BBC Business Reporter, Basel

documents.title: foxconn to purchase belkin for $ 866m
text: taiwanese iphone supplier foxconn is to purchase us consumer electronics and home networking product maker belkin international for $ 886m ( £ 626.4m ) .

foxcon 's cable and connector division fit hong teng said in a filing to the hong kong stock exchange that a potential merger with belkin would give it access to technology , sales networks and more production capabilities .
fit is keen to start a new smart home business that will incorporate belkin 's wireless communication businesses linksys and wemo with similar fit products .
the merger is subject to approval from the us committee on foreign investment .

documents.title: pubs in danger : six charts on how the british drink
text: across the uk , people are spending more money on gin and craft beer , and there are more breweries open today than there were in the 1930s .
but 18 pubs across the country closed every week in the second half of 2017 , according tothe campaign for real ale ( camra ) .
so how are uk drinking habits changing ?
what are the uk 's favourite drinks and how often are adults drinking ?

documents.title: stagecoach says revenue growth consistent
text: stagecoach has issued its first trading update since the uk government said in february that it was required to withdraw from running the east coast mainline franchise with virgin trains three years earlier in 2020 .
the transport provider said that revenue growth across rail operations was broadly consistent with the first half .
stagecoach said that its earnings expectations for the year ending 28 april 2018 had not changed from when it announced interim results in december .
like-for-like revenue growth for the financial year to date for its uk rail unit was 3.2 % and the virgin rail group joint venture climbed 2.8 % .
however , its uk bus london division fell by 4.3 % , followed by its north american operations , which slid 0.6 % due to severe weather over the winter months .
regional uk bus operations decreased by 0.1 % .
shares in stagecoach are now down 1.91 % to 128.7p .

documents.title: revolving door swings for halfords ' finance chief
text: the revolving door between some of the uk 's most recognisable high street brands continues .
halfords ' finance chief jonny mason has announced that he is moving to dixons carphone as group financial director .

mr mason was briefly interim chief executive at halfords from september 2017 to january 2018 , before the bike and car accessory retailer 's current chief executive graham stapleton joined from dixons carphone .
and mr mason is the replacement for humphrey singer , who is leaving dixons carphone and heading over to m & s to become its finance boss .

documents.title: zuckerberg asks 'authoritative ' person to answer mps questions
text: facebook will not be sending facebook 's co-founder and chief executive mark zuckerberg to answer questions over users data from the digital , culture , media and sport committee .

it its letter to the committee 's chair damian collins , its head of public policy in the uk , rebecca stimson says : `` facebook fully recognises the level of public and parliamentary interest in these issues and support your belief that these issues must be addressed at the most senior levels of the company by those in an authoritative position to answer your questions .
`` as such mr zuckerberg has personally asked one of his deputies to make themselves available to give evidence in person to the committee . ''

documents.title: akzo nobel strikes €10.1bn chemicals sale
text: akzo nobel , the dutch group which last year fought off a hostile bid from us rival ppg , has sold its specialty chemical business for €10.1bn ( £ 8.8bn ) .

it is selling the unit to us private equity firm carlyle and singapore sovereign investor gic and said it is `` in the best interests of akzonobel , specialty chemicals and its respective stakeholders , including employees , shareholders and customers '' .

documents.title: gsk shares jump on rising ftse 100
text: the ftse 100 made a strong start to trading on tuesday following a recovery in us and asia stocks as fears of a trade war appeared to recede .
the blue chip index of leading stocks rose 1.4 % to 6,984.91 .
fresh from announcing a $ 13bn deal to buy novartis ' stake in a consumer healthcare products joint venture , gsk 's shares jumped by 3 % to £ 13.28 .
heating and plumbing specialist ferguson led the risers , however , up 4.9 % to £ 53.86 after reporting a rise in interim profit .
the ftse 250 is ahead nearly 1 % at 19,369.26 .
meanwhile , the pound fell back below $ 1.42 .
it dipped 0.25 % on the dollar to $ 1.41950 .

documents.title: upbeat game shares jump despite profit fall
text: shares in game digital jumped 5.88 % to 25.41p in early trading after the home entertainment retailer reported a positive outlook .
investors sent the stock higher despite a 25.5 % fall in interim pre-tax profits to £ 12.3m on sales 3.9 % higher at £ 517.4m .

chief executive martyn gibbs said that while `` the overall console market is expected to be more challenging '' in the second half because of strong comparatives to last year when the nintendo switch was launched , the company is optimistic given the `` stronger line up of games announced and anticipated '' .
these include call of duty : black ops 4 , red dead redemption 2 , the division 2 and shadow of the tomb raider .

documents.title: superdry co-founder steps down , gives to charity
text: julian dunkerton , one of the founders of the high street chain superdry is stepping down `` to devote more time to his other business and charitable interests '' .

at the same time , he said that he will transfer shares worth up to £ 1.1m by way of a charitable donation to the blue marine foundation , `` that exists to protect our seas , by combating overfishing and the destruction of biodiversity with the creation of large scale marine reserves '' .

documents.title: 'bad timing ' for spotify flotation
text: music streaming service spotify is set to list on the new york stock exchange on 3 april .
but james dale , managing director of lgm records , reckons now is not a great time to float .
`` i fear for them as it 's a particularly bad time for them to do it , '' he tells the today programme .

`` obviously tech firms have not had a good couple of weeks and the way daniel ek [ spotify 's co-founder and chief executive ] chose to encourage people that it 's a good time for the company - despite regular losses of over $ 300m a year - has been to say that there 's opportunity to diversify into advertising and data . ''
he says : `` they 're not a big data company , and big data and advertising is under great scrutiny at the moment in tech companies , so i do worry for them .
it 's a bit bad timing . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: the state of retail , according to moss bros
text: moss bros ' chief executive brian brick is not pulling any punches about the situation the menswear business finds itself in .
he says : `` going forward , we are planning for an extremely challenging retail environment , not least because of the uncertain consumer environment and significant cost headwinds .
`` however , there is no question that we have hampered our own position through the stock shortages and as this gets back on track , our strong consumer proposition is restoring momentum . ''

he adds : `` the early response to the 2018 spring/summer retail range has been positive although our lack of stock has been challenging and as a result , retail like-for-like sales are below the same period last year . ''

documents.title: london markets jump in opening trade
text: the ftse 100 index jumped by 85.63 points , or 1.24 % , in opening trade to 6,974.32 .
the ftse 250 added 174.46 points , or 0.92 % , to 19,361.55

documents.title: vw in a fix over limp remedy
text: carmaker volkswagen ( vw ) is facing the biggest consumer class action in england and wales in history over the emissions scandal , led by law firm slater and gordon .
gareth pope , a principal litigation solicitor for slater and gordon told the today programme , says the issue is n't just about the fact that vw lied - the fix it provided does n't actually work .
he says : `` in some occasion it has led to cars entering limp mode , which is a real concern for people travelling at 70 mph on the motorway , and suddenly their car sees a reduction in power . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: moss bros takes stock of tough trading
text: last week , menswear group moss bros said profits in its current financial year would be below expectations .
but in its results for the year to 27 january , profits also fell .
it sales pre-tax income dropped by 6.1 % to £ 6.7m on revenue up 3 % at £ 131.8m .
like-for-like sales , which excludes trade from new shops opened during the year , fell by 6.2 % .
moss bros ' chief executive brian brick said that after a strong first half , the final quarter was below expectations .
he said : `` we suffered from a significant stock shortage , due to the poor implementation of the project to consolidate suppliers .
we left ourselves with too little 'running line ' stock to close out the year having bought cautiously for the second half of 2017 .
`` this has continued to hamper our performance into the start of the year . ''

documents.title: 'non-disclosure agreements should be unlawful '
text: rebecca hilsenrath , chief executive of the equality and human rights commission , says that it wants non-disclosure agreements to be made unlawful , so companies can not use them to bully sexual harassment victims into silence .

`` a victim is not in a place to say an agreement should n't be confidential , and as a result , the perpetrator is then to free to do it again and again to the next woman down the corridor , '' she told the today programme .
zelda perkins , a former assistant to disgraced film producer harvey weinstein , will be appearing before a committee of mps tomorrow to talk about her experience .
`` i really was manipulated [ into signing a non-disclosure agreement ] with the weinstein company .
i was really given no choice , '' she told today .
`` the legal profession are enabling the perpetrators - people who have a lot of power or wealth - i think there needs to be a disincentive for the legal profession as well as employers . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: energy firm banned from taking on new custmomers
text: energy regulator ofgem has banned supplier iresa from taking on new customers for up to 3 months until it resolves service issues .
the company also can not increase existing customers ' direct debits or ask them for one-off-payments during this period .
ofgem says that if iresa fails to carry out a number of measures within the next three months , it will take further action , which could , ultimately , lead to it revoking the company 's licence .

the regulator 's chief executive dermot nolan , said : `` this order sends out a very clear message to suppliers that where they fail their customers on service , ofgem will step in and take strong action . ''

documents.title: melrose answers back
text: melrose 's chief executive simon peckham has reassured business secretary greg clark that the company intends to invest in gkn if its £ 7.8bn is successful .
in his reply to the mp , he says that for a period of five years , melrose will :

he also said that gkn 's plan to sell its us automotive business driveline to dana `` is not in the best interests of gkn 's employees , pensioners , customers , suppliers , shareholders or the wider uk economy .
in fact , i would go further - it places them at risk '' .

documents.title: uk is an open economy , says greg clark
text: in his letter dated 26 march to melrose chief executive simon peckham , business secretary greg clark says : `` i want to be clear that the government is committed to an open economy and to the belief that in most regards markets and shareholders should decide the outcome of takeover bids .

`` where , however , there are broader interests at play and in particular where public investment is directly or indirectly at stake i do expect potential acquirers to reflect these in their approach and the commitments they are prepared to make . ''

documents.title: business secretary sets out conditions for gkn deal
text: as expected , there is another development in the takeover battle between gkn and melrose .

letters between business secretary greg clark and melrose 's chief executive simon peckham have been published this morning and the mp details the commitments it wants the company to make if its £ 7.8bn bid for the automotive and aerospace parts maker is successful .

documents.title: investors worried over 'challenging governance '
text: facebook is facing an investigation from the us federal trade commission over how private data on millions of users was given to cambridge analytica .
the social network 's stock is down 16 % for the year to date , with shares falling on monday by 4 % on the announcement .
`` the share price responds to the reputational damage as much as anything else , '' mike amey , managing director and portfolio manager at pimco , told the today programme .
`` what investors look for is governance , and signs of challenging governance is where investors start to get worried . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: novartis 'to focus on core businesses '
text: novartis ' chief executive vas narasimhan says that selling its 36.5 % stake in its consumer healthcare joint venture with gsk for $ 13bn will allow it to `` further focus on the development and growth of its core businesses '' .
he says : `` while our consumer healthcare joint venture with gsk is progressing well , the time is right for novartis to divest a non-core asset at an attractive price .

`` this will strengthen our ability to allocate capital to grow our core businesses , drive shareholder returns , and execute value creating bolt-on acquisitions as we continue to build the leading medicines company , powered by digital and data . ''

documents.title: 'gkn needed to be improved '
text: the latest news in turnaround firm melrose 's hostile takeover bid for british engineering giant gkn is that us car parts maker dana has upped its offer to buy gkn 's driveline business by $ 140m ( £ 98.4m ) .
mps and the pensions watchdog have called for the deal to be blocked , but not everyone thinks that melrose is the bad guy in this situation .

`` many have the mistaken belief that melrose are just asset strippers - they believe the status quo will prevail under existing management , '' ben bourne , a capital goods analyst at liberum told bbc radio 4 's today programme .
`` gkn needed to be improved - we 've seen melrose improve businesses ever since 2005 , and be jolly good at it , and create plenty of value for shareholders , we think we will see it again . ''
he added that melrose `` delivers value '' by incentivising managers and investing in better machinery .
gkn is hoping to head off the takeover bid by selling off its automotive business and doubling down on aerospace , but mr bourne does n't think this will work .
`` the problem is that business will be left with a large gross pensions liability , '' he said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: uber responds to arizona suspension
text: overnight arizona governor doug ducey suspended uber 's self-driving tests following a fatal collision in tempe .
a spokesperson for uber , said : `` we proactively suspended self-driving operations in all cities immediately following the tragic incident last week .
`` we continue to help investigators in any way we can , and we 'll keep a dialogue open with the governor 's office to address any concerns they have . ''

documents.title: major step for gsk
text: the deal between gsk and norvatis stems from a rather complicated transaction agreed back in 2014 .
back then , gsk sold a portfolio of cancer drugs to switzerland 's novartis for $ 16bn and bought novartis ' vaccines business for $ 7.1bn .
on top of that , gsk and novartis said they would combine their consumer health businesses in a joint venture controlled by the uk company .
it includes brands such as oral health brands such as sensodyne , aquafresh and pain relief products including panadol .
the deal was done under gsk 's then boss sir andrew witty .

commenting on today 's deal , his successor emma walmsley , said : `` the proposed transaction addresses one of our key capital allocation priorities and will allow gsk shareholders to capture the full value of one of the world 's leading consumer healthcare businesses . ''

documents.title: sexual harassment victims being silenced
text: corrosive work cultures have silenced victims of sexual harassment - according to a report released today by the equality and human rights commission ( ehrc ) .
in 2017 , the trade union congress conducted research that found that just over half of women have experienced sexual harrassment in the workplace .
the ehrc says there is a lack of effective action being taken by companies and it has drawn up a series of recommendations that it wants the uk government to implement .

according to bbc 's business correspondent rob young , the most eye-catching recommendation is that companies prevented by law from using non-disclosure agreements to sweep sexual harassment claims under the carpet .
the commission feels non-disclosure agreements have been used to silence victims , such as in the aftermath of the presidents club charity dinner scandal .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: good night for horlicks ?
text: gsk has just announced that it will buy 36.5 % stake in a consumer healthcare joint venture from swiss healthcare giant novartis for $ 13bn .
as part of the decision , gsk said that it is initiating `` a strategic review '' of horlicks and other consumer nutrition products to fund the deal .
it said that the majority of horlicks and other nutrition products sales are generated in india .
these are sold by glaxosmithkline consumer healthcare ltd which is floated in india .
gsk said the review will include an assessment of its 72.5 % shareholding in the company .

documents.title: china 's largest airline flying high
text: china is the world 's second-largest aviation market .
and increasing demand for air travel among the growing middle class means it 'll overtake the us as the top market in the next few years .
that is all good news for the country 's major airlines - who report their 2017 results this week .
first out the blocks is china southern airlines - the largest carrier not just in china but in asia .
it saw net profit jump 18 % last year to 5.96 billion yuan ( £ 670m ; $ 960m ) .
that was largely thanks to a refocussing on domestic routes - which which made up around three-quarters of the company 's passenger revenue .
a little while ago we took an in-depth look at asia 's aviation industry in graphics , which is here in case you missed it .

Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: a tricky balancing act
text: stock markets are volatile , interest rates are edging higher so where should investors be putting their money ?
mike amey , managing director and portfolio manager at pimco , the asset management group , tells wake up to money central banks face a balancing act .

`` interest rates have been super low , in fact zero more or less , and so investors not unreasonably look for alternative places to put their money and that obviously is one of the reasons that stocks have done very well because you get a better return . ''

he says though as interest rates go up , as they are doing in the us and could do in the uk in may : `` there becomes a point in time where investors say 'well , i understand that interest rates are still low but at least i 've got security of return on that and stocks have been extremely volatile ' . ''

he says that for the likes of jerome powell , the new chairman of the us federal reserve ( `` he now needs to work out [ how ] to raise rates and to get that off zero because they do n't need zero interest rates anymore but also not to kill the economy '' .
`` that 's why they 're going slowly because it 's quite a tricky business . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: asia markets rise as trade war fears subside
text: asia 's markets were up on tuesday , following wall street 's lead , as concerns over a trade war between the us and china eased .
japan 's nikkei 225 was up close to 2 % in early morning trade , led by a recovering tech sector .
in china , hong kong 's hang seng index was up 0.82 % to 30,801.2 points , while the shanghai composite had gained 1 % in mid morning trade to 30,794.36 .
